full_text: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-G DATE: 08/08/2019 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 123 123 b(6); (b)(7)(C) 0-8:30 AM 4:00-4:30 PM 405 405 b(6); (b)(7)(C) 12:30- 1:00 AM 1245 1246 0- 9:00 AM 4:30-5:00 PM 430 432 1:00-1:30 AM 114 115 0-9:30 AM 5:00 -5:30 PM 535 532 1:30-2:00 AM 153 154 0-10:00 AM 5:30-6:00 PM 536 536 2:00-2:30 AM 219 220 00-10:30 AM 6:00-6:30 PM 601 601 2:30-3:00 AM 234 239 30-11:00 AM 6:30-7:00 PM 688 639 3:00-3:30 AM 309 337 00-11:30 AM 7:00-7:30 PM 701 701 3:30-4:00 AM 335 336 30-12:00 AM 7:30-8:00 PM 734 734 4:00-4:30 AM 423 424 00-12:30 PM 8:00-8:30 PM 800 801 4:30-5:00 AM 444 445 30- 1:00 PM 8:30- 9:00 PM 835 835 5:00 -5:30 AM 509 511 0-1:30 PM 9:00-9:30 PM 903 903 5:30-6:00 AM 540 541 0-2:00 PM 9:30-10:00 PM 923 6:00-6:30 AM 621 622 0-2:30 PM 10:00-10:30 PM 1007 6:30-7:00 AM 634 635 0-3:00 PM 10:30-11:00 PM 1032 1032 7:00-7:30 AM 701 702 0-3:30 PM 11:00-11:30 PM 1100 7:30-8:00 AM 732 733 0-4:00 PM 11:30-12:00 PM 1134 1134 MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT b(6); (b)(7)(C) DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT b(6); (b)(7)(C) WATCH NS NT b(6); (b)(7)(C) A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN
